alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 5:50PM EST until December 19 at 1:52PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Moderate to Major severity and increased in duration for the following rivers in New Jersey... Raritan River At Bound Brook affecting Somerset and Middlesex Counties. For the Raritan River...including Bound Brook...Major flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Moderate flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Raritan River at Bound Brook. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Backyard and low areas are protected by levees and the flood wall. Without the levees or if there is a breach in the levees, minor flooding will occur. At 30.0 feet, Main Street is protected by flap valves/sluice gates. This level triggers the gate closures to protect Main Street. At 33.0 feet, A large portion of Bound Brook is protected by the flood reduction project. Pump station operations become critical, at this stage, for the continued protection of the borough. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 5:15 PM EST Monday the stage was 32.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 5:15 PM EST Monday was 32.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 33.0 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 28.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.1 feet on 09/09/2011. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Tue Wed Stg Time Date Raritan River Bound Brook 28.0 32.4 Mon 5 pm 27.0 22.1 33.0 1am 12/19 &&
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning at 600 AM EST.
